labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: Requirements for covering NIPC
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body:
In this issue, we can list the requirements we need to fulfill to cover NIPC via the instance information document. The following list is just an initial starting point that will be extended over the course of future discussions.


- [ ] Include an `instanceId` in the events contained in an event history?
- [ ] Include an `instanceId` action states?
- [ ] Clarify where to put context information such as the SCIM ID (currently, this information is placed in the `$context`)
- [ ] Discuss and clarify how ~~`protocolMap`~~ `sdfProtocolMap` fits into the instance information concept

It would also be great if @bbrinckman could give us direct feedback on what the proofshot format needs to work with NIPC and what potential requirements are.

issues.title: Take context into account when generating proofshot content
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body: During the ASDF session at IETF 123, it came up that the content of proofshot might differ depending on the context, for example for privacy reasons. This could lead to the omission of some qualities in the proofshot or different values that are assigned to them.

issues.title: Consider describing `offDevice` information with `sdfContext` quality
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body: For a potential alignment with the ETRI-Draft on `sdfNonAffordance`-Information, we should consider using a keyword such as `sdfContext` instead, that was one of the potential proposals made by @jungha-hong during the ASDF meeting at IETF 123. In a PR, we should update the examples with the potential new keyword in order to investigate how well it can cover our use cases and requirements.

pulls.title: Add proofshot and non-affordance examples
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: This PR will eventually add examples and some additional text to the draft. Currently, the content of this PR is still WIP, therefore I marked it as a draft for now.

pulls.title: Update Jan's affiliation
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: I am now mainly affiliated with the University of Bremen again. This simple PR reflects that in the document.

pulls.title: Fix figure references in captions
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: Since the ordering of the figures has changed in the latest version of draft-lee-asdf-digital-twin, this PR updates the captions within the document to reflect that (sorry for not noticing this earlier).

pulls.title: Yaml source for figures and other editorial nits in -00
pulls.author: cabo

pulls.title: Update proofshot examples
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: This PR will eventually incorporate the feedback and discussions from the OneDM meeting on April 10, 2025, into the document.

comments.author: JKRhb
comments.body:
@mjkoster @akeranen Thank you once more for the very interesting discussion yesterday! Based on our results, I hope that I was now able to make the PR a bit more concise and improve upon the actual examples, so that an (initial) review should now be possible :) I will probably work a bit more on this over the course of the weekend, but any feedback is greatly appreciated already. 

Btw: You can find a diff of the rendered version [here](https://author-tools.ietf.org/api/iddiff?url_1=https://ietf-wg-asdf.github.io/instance-information/draft-bormann-asdf-instance-information.txt&url_2=https://ietf-wg-asdf.github.io/instance-information/adjust-examples/draft-bormann-asdf-instance-information.txt) and the rendered version in full [here](https://ietf-wg-asdf.github.io/instance-information/adjust-examples/draft-bormann-asdf-instance-information.html).

comments.author: JKRhb
comments.body: The changes that have been moved to #6 have now been removed from this PR via cad0984.

I think this is now moving to "roads not taken".
We want to be able to use an SDF model to describe (constrain) instances; we probably don't want to make SDF models a meta-model of themselves...
The proofshot example shows actual values; the semantic information from the model (e.g., units, ecosystem-specific semantics) still applies but is not part of the proofshot (a reference to the model is).

pulls.title: Adjust construction examples
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: This PR extracts the construction-related adjustments from #5 into its own PR to better differentiate between changes to the proofshot and constructor examples.

pulls.title: Add initial CDDL schema for SDF proofshots
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: This PR contains a first attempt at creating a CDDL schema for SDF proofshots. Due to some problems with the available tooling, I haven't been able to fully verify that the schema is correct and works as intended; also, there are still a couple of points that need discussion. Still, I hope that the schema will work as a starting point for further discussions.

pulls.title: Add example for proofshot deltas
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
This PR adds an initial example for a proofshot delta that refers to a previous proofshot via its ID.

All of this is still pretty rough, but it should enable further discussions regarding the proofshot delta concept.

pulls.title: Fix issues with CDDL proofshot schema
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: I am having some trouble to properly run the validation locally, but I hope that this PR resolves at least some of the issues we were observing with the proofshot CDDL schema that was added in #8.

pulls.title: Update "Roads not taken" examples to `I-D.lee-asdf-digital-twin-08`
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
This PR updates the examples in the appendix to version -08 of the digital twin draft to be more consistent with the examples from the main part of the document. This changes also enables us to remove the -07 reference in order to only have one draft version referenced.

Note that I had some small difficulties updating the examples, since the approach in -08 is still a bit inconsistent. However, as these examples only serve an illustrative purpose to begin with, I hope that the updates are fine (after a few adjustments, if needed).

pulls.title: Start specifying an action-based constructor approach
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
As discussed yesterday, this PR provides an initial example for an alternative constructor approach where `sdfAction`s are reused instead of introducing a new keyword.

There are still a number of aspects that require discussion here, but the PR should be a first step toward making a more informed discussion.

comments.body:
- [x] Move `target` under `construct`
  - Link to question: What model is valid here?
- [x] Remove `temperature` and required
- [ ] Use as basis for further discussion

One thing I noticed here is that the example is now rather a factory for models instead of documents related to instances (with the `ipAdress` being an exception as a piece of context information).

I guess the question would be what kinds of output we produce from the constructor – would it be an extended model and a proofshot? Or rather a mapping file and a proofshot?

```suggestion
Lastly, it is currently unclear what kind of schema information should be provided for the action's `sdfOutputData`.
As a return value, a pointer to the instantiated device and/or the models describing it could make sense.
```

pulls.title: Add rules for CDDL validation to Makefile
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: This PR takes over the code for validating the SDF models within the draft from the SDF Mapping repository.

pulls.title: Remove temperature and a redundant required indication from proofshots
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: Looking at the diff of the two latest draft versions, I noticed a couple of small mistakes which I wanted to fix with this PR. I also added a "DISCUSS" comment to the example for the proofshot delta constructor, which might not be that suitable as an example after all.

pulls.title: Model context and offDevice information via sdfContext
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
This PR contains a proposal for replacing and unifying the previous usages of `offDevice` and `$context` via an `sdfContext` quality (which is a potential replacement for the `sdfNonAffordance` quality introduced by @jungha-hong et al.).

Reading through the updated examples, I think this resolves some of the open questions in the draft document quite well and contributes to a cleaner separation of model and instance information.

When merged, this PR resolves #17.

pulls.title: Experiment with `sdfRelation` for specifying constructors and parameter targets
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
This morning, I had the idea that `sdfRelation` might be a good way of linking constructors and their parameters to their designated targets without introducing new targets. This solution would also resolve the question of how to identify a constructor. The question of how to indicate a constructor _preference_ is still open, though.

This PR depends on #18 and should be merged afterward in order to decrease the diff size.
